?
本件保存七年
02-42- 1433 1 BOA超站 May 8, 2 ®
To : Mr. N. F. Shambarger, Controller, US AID/C
From : 0. 0. Chang, Chief, Second Division, CUSA C. C. Chang
Original signed by
Subject : xcess Equipment Project, o. 99-171
Referring to a draft Audit Report No. A-1711 which was forwarded to us for clearance, we wish to male the following comments with regard to the subject project:
(1) "Records" BES is the handling agency for sicess equip- ment procured abroad and keeps necessary records. On the part of LUSA, matters pertaining to this pro- jeet are handled by its various offices in accordance with their respective justkons. The Second Division of CUSA handles programming and allocation and has records as required; similarly do the other offices.
(2) "Long-ixled iems During a periol about one year ago, singole quantities of excess supplies which had not been requested or were in excess of the requested quantilies wore shipped from USA under PIQ/0 00043 and PI0/880,50, the procurement agency of both PIO/C's being GsA/Pas/FUu. Efforts had constantly been made to utilize these unexpected arrivals to the best advantage. Major portion has thus been allocated or sold though there is still a portion which remains in BES yard end is being unter sale by GTC. Lately, SDC has approached UTC for purchase of some of these sup- pliss and delivery will be made upon payment . The quantities of' unsold items have been considerably reduced through months of efforts by relevant offices.
(3) "BES storage condition" The storage condition at 885 yard has been improved as practicable. As tie excess equipment are stored in BES yard only for a short period ard consist mainly of heavy construction equipment which can stand weathering, no construction of warehouse for their storage is ever contemplated.
E-16.13.2
國史饭
Academia Historica
D

paragraphs.content: To : Mr. N. F. Shambarger, Controller, US AID/C
From : 0. 0. Chang, Chief, Second Division, CUSA C. C. Chang
Referring to a draft Audit Report No. A-1711 which was forwarded to us for clearance, we wish to male the following comments with regard to the subject project:

(1) "Records" BES is the handling agency for sicess equip- ment procured abroad and keeps necessary records. On the part of LUSA, matters pertaining to this pro- jeet are handled by its various offices in accordance with their respective justkons. The Second Division of CUSA handles programming and allocation and has records as required; similarly do the other offices.

(2) "Long-ixled iems During a periol about one year ago, singole quantities of excess supplies which had not been requested or were in excess of the requested quantilies wore shipped from USA under PIQ/0 00043 and PI0/880,50, the procurement agency of both PIO/C's being GsA/Pas/FUu. Efforts had constantly been made to utilize these unexpected arrivals to the best advantage. Major portion has thus been allocated or sold though there is still a portion which remains in BES yard end is being unter sale by GTC. Lately, SDC has approached UTC for purchase of some of these sup- pliss and delivery will be made upon payment . The quantities of' unsold items have been considerably reduced through months of efforts by relevant offices.

(3) "BES storage condition" The storage condition at 885 yard has been improved as practicable. As tie excess equipment are stored in BES yard only for a short period ard consist mainly of heavy construction equipment which can stand weathering, no construction of warehouse for their storage is ever contemplated.
